io.spine.server.route

Class StateUpdateRouting<I>

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.spine.server.route.StateUpdateRouting<I>
  • Type Parameters:
    I - the type of the entity IDs to which the updates are routed
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Route<io.spine.base.EntityState,io.spine.core.EventContext,java.util.Set<I>>, java.io.Serializable, java.util.function.BiFunction<io.spine.base.EntityState,io.spine.core.EventContext,java.util.Set<I>>

    public final class StateUpdateRouting<I>
extends java.lang.Object
    A routing schema used to deliver entity state updates.

    A routing schema consists of a default route and custom routes per entity state class. When calculating targets to be notified on the updated state, StateUpdateRouting would see if there is a custom route set for the type of the entity state. If not found, the default route will be applied.

    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • newInstance

        public static <I> StateUpdateRouting<I> newInstance(java.lang.Class<I> idClass)
        Creates a new StateUpdateRouting.

        The resulting routing schema has the ignoring default route, i.e. if a custom route is not set, the entity state update is ignored.

        Type Parameters:
        I - the type of the entity IDs to which the updates are routed
        Parameters:
        idClass - the class of identifiers served by this routing
        Returns:
        new StateUpdateRouting

      • supports

        public boolean supports(java.lang.Class<? extends io.spine.base.EntityState> stateType)
        Verifies if the passed state type can be routed by a custom route, or the message has a field matching the type of identifiers served by this routing.

      • route

        @CanIgnoreReturnValue
public <S extends io.spine.base.EntityState> StateUpdateRouting<I> route(java.lang.Class<S> stateClass,
                                                                                               StateUpdateRoute<I,S> via)
                                                                                        throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Sets a custom route for the passed entity state class.

        If there is no specific route for the class of the passed entity state, the routing will use the default route.

        Type Parameters:
        S - the type of the entity state message
        Parameters:
        stateClass - the class of entity states to route
        via - the instance of the route to be used
        Returns:
        this to allow chained calls when configuring the routing
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the route for this class is already set

      • apply

        public R apply(M message,
               C context)
        Obtains IDs of entities to which the passed message should be delivered.

        If there is no function for the passed message applies the default function.
